brief_description: 10 adult participants of dose group 3x10^6 pfu, and 10 participants of dose group 20x10^6 pfu. Reads were aligned to the human reference assembly (GRCh38.p7) using STAR software (v2.4.2a; option '--quantMode GeneCounts'). Gene annotation was obtained from Ensembl (release 79, ensemble.org). VOOM+Limma analysis (R software, version 3.2.2) was used to assess differential gene expression at each post-vaccination day (d1, d3 and d7) against baseline (d0). Next, we intergreted gene expression data and antibody response using an sPLS algorithm, in order to down-select genes correlating with multivariate antibody responses at days 28, 54, 84,180.
brief_title: Next Generation Sequencing RNA Seq data from UKE Phase I rVSV ZEBOV vaccine clinical trial, from full blood samples on Days 0,1,3,7
condition_studied: UKE Phase I rVSV ZEBOV vaccine

VOOM+Limma analysis (R software, version 3.2.2) was used to assess differential gene expression at each post-vaccination day (d1, d3 and d7) against baseline (d0). Next, we intergreted gene expression data and antibody response using an sPLS algorithm, in order to down-select genes correlating with multivariate antibody responses at days 28, 54, 84,180.
hypothesis: 3x10^6 pfu and 20x10^6 pfu doses of UKE Phase 1 rVSV ZEBOV vaccine will affect gene expression
intervention_agent: UKE Phase I rVSV ZEBOV vaccine and effect on differential gene expression
objectives: Gene expression by RNA Sequencing and Array to determine efficacy of vaccine
official_title: Next Generation Sequencing RNA Seq data from UKE Phase I rVSV ZEBOV vaccine clinical trial, from full blood samples on Days 0,1,3,7

arm.name: dose 3x10^6 pfu

pubmed.title: Systems Vaccinology Identifies an Early Innate Immune Signature as a Correlate of Antibody Responses to the Ebola Vaccine rVSV-ZEBOV.
